results.adx_keywords: Amazon.com Inc;Cloud Computing;E-Commerce;Shopping and Retail;Bezos, Jeffrey P
results.title: How Amazon’s Long Game Yielded a Retail Juggernaut
results.abstract: Jeff Bezos bucked the trend of seeking short-term results to create an addictive shopping experience few can match. And his newer enterprise is a blockbuster, too.

media.caption: Parcel delivery in Battery Park City in New York. One analyst predicts that in five years, 50 percent of American households will have joined Amazon Prime.

results.byline: By MIKE ISAAC and KATIE BENNER
results.title: LivingSocial Offers a Cautionary Tale to Today’s Unicorns
results.abstract: A former darling of the start-up world, the company offers a glimpse of what some of today’s biggest start-ups might look like several years down the road.

media.caption: Gautam Thakar, the company’s chief, says LivingSocial will rely less on daily deals in its next act.
media.copyright: Lexey Swall for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Microsoft Corp;Cyberattacks and Hackers;Computer Security;Cloud Computing;Nadella, Satya;Phishing (Computer Fraud)
results.title: Microsoft Sheds Reputation as an Easy Mark for Hackers
results.abstract: As episodes of online hacking have become even more startling, the company has been evolving to confront security threats and improve how information is shared.

media.caption: Microsoft’s chief executive, Satya Nadella, spoke on Tuesday about how Microsoft has evolved to confront security threats.

results.title: Foiling Electronic Snoops in Email
results.abstract: Trackers inserted into email can detect when a person opens a message and where they are when they do so. And it’s not easy to thwart them.

results.adx_keywords: International Business Machines Corporation;Design;Gilbert, Phil G Sr (1956- );Rometty, Virginia M;Mobile Applications;Cloud Computing;Software;Computers and the Internet
results.title: IBM’s Design-Centered Strategy to Set Free the Squares
results.abstract: The tech stalwart has been hiring designers by the hundreds, all part of an accelerated approach to product development that is a major departure from the past.

results.adx_keywords: Ireland;Corporate Taxes;Intellectual Property;Cork (Ireland);Tax Shelters;Taxation;Computers and the Internet
results.title: After Outcry, Ireland Adjusts Its Corporate Tax Draw
results.abstract: The country has been accused of acting like a low-tax haven, giving breaks that have attracted international companies. Now Ireland is phasing out some breaks, but adding another.

media.caption: Chris O’Leary, lord mayor of Cork, Ireland, which has drawn multinationals.
media.copyright: Paulo Nunes dos Santos for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Google Inc;Greene, Diane B;Cloud Computing;Appointments and Executive Changes;Alphabet Inc;VMware Inc;EMC Corporation;Bebop Technologies;Rosenblum, Mendel
results.title: Google Picks Diane Greene to Expand Its Cloud Business
results.abstract: Ms. Greene, a Silicon Valley veteran, has been a board member of Google and founded Bebop Technologies, which Google has agreed to buy.

results.adx_keywords: Seattle (Wash);San Francisco (Calif);Affordable Housing;Silicon Valley (Calif);Area Planning and Renewal
results.title: Seattle, in Midst of Tech Boom, Tries to Keep Its Soul
results.abstract: The city’s leaders are hoping to avoid the pitfalls bedeviling San Francisco — surging home prices, less diversity — as its tech scene expands.

media.caption: Beyond Amazon and Microsoft, Seattle’s tech scene in the last 10 years has come to include dozens of smaller companies.

results.adx_keywords: Video Recordings, Downloads and Streaming;Copyrights and Copyright Violations;YouTube.com;Naral Pro-Choice America;Electronic Frontier Foundation
results.title: YouTube to Pay Fees for Some Video Makers to Fight Takedowns
results.abstract: The company, which will initially pay the legal costs of four video creators, says it wants to protect free speech and educate its users on fair use rules.

media.caption: Constantine Guiliotis of UFO Theater is one of the video makers YouTube will defend against future legal action.

results.title: Fans Demand Details After Death of a 13-Year-Old YouTube Star
results.abstract: Curiosity surrounding the death was so intense that the boy’s relatives and the authorities were pressed to release further details surrounding how he died.

media.caption: The “Bratayley” siblings, including Caleb, left, at an event in Australia in September.

results.adx_keywords: Colleges and Universities;Sex Crimes;Pomona College;University of San Francisco;Start-ups;Sexual Health Innovations
results.title: The War on Campus Sexual Assault Goes Digital
results.abstract: Students at some colleges can use a service called Callisto to anonymously record the details of a sexual assault and later file a report if they choose.

media.caption: Jessica Ladd, founder and chief executive of Sexual Health Innovations, whose Callisto service lets college students anonymously record details of sexual assaults and report them later. She came up with the idea after she was assaulted as an undergraduate.
media.copyright: Elizabeth D. Herman for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Dating and Relationships; Facebook Inc; Social Media
results.title: Facebook to Make Breaking Up Easier to Do
results.abstract: Facebook has added an awkward wrinkle to breaking up with someone. But the social media giant has a new tool that helps automate the process of moving on with your life.

media.caption: With Facebook’s new feature, you can choose not to have the person show up in your news feed, and that person's name will not be suggested when a photo is tagged or a new message written.

results.adx_keywords: Amazon.com Inc;Mozilla Foundation;iPhone;Virtual Reality (Computers);Privacy;Web Browsers;Google Inc;Video Recordings, Downloads and Streaming;Google Cardboard
results.title: Covering Your Browser Tracks
results.abstract: A look at Do Not Track technology in web browsers, and how to use Google Cardboard effectively.

results.adx_keywords: Facebook Inc; Family Leaves; Paid Time Off; Parenting; Silicon Valley (Calif); Work-Life Balance; Workplace Environment; Zuckerberg, Mark E
results.title: Mark Zuckerberg Plans 2-Month Paternity Leave From Facebook
results.abstract: Family leave policies have become the subject of much discussion in the tech industry, and a number of top companies have increased the parental leave they offer.

results.byline: By VINDU GOEL and SYDNEY EMBER
results.title: As Paris Terror Attacks Unfolded, Social Media Tools Offered Help in Crisis
results.abstract: Facebook activated its Safety Check tool while Twitter put its new Moments tool to use, highlighting top news tweets about the attacks.

media.caption: Rescue workers and victims at the site of an attack at a Paris restaurant.

results.adx_keywords: Advertising and Marketing; Computers and the Internet; E-Mail; Online Advertising; Software; Yahoo! Inc
results.byline: By MIKE ISAAC and SYDNEY EMBER
results.title: Yahoo Restricts Ad-Blocking Software for Some Email Users
results.abstract: Yahoo blocked some users from accessing their Yahoo email accounts unless they switched off their ad blockers, adding to the debate over ad blocking.

media.caption: Marissa Mayer, chief of Yahoo, at a panel discussion in San Francisco this month.
